AttributeSet.Name: @All
AttributeSet.Description: the fields used on all input types

Value.Value: The field label as shown in the edit form
Input Type
Hidden field which tells the UI what input-type to use in a dynamic form
Default Value
Note that you can also set the default value of a drop-down, just remember to use the Key of the drop-down, not the displayed text.
Default value for this field - used when this field is first filled in
Help / Instructions
These things help to guide the user. We recommend to use the placeholder a lot, as it's only visible when the field is empty and will not clutter as the form is filled up.
This text will appear in the background of empty fields

Add notes / helpfull comments to aid the editor in adding his information. Note that you have a WYSIWYG for this field, but be really carefull to not add too much nonsense or similar because it might break the tool-tip in DotNetNuke.

You can also add helpfull links if necessary, like www.2sexycontent.org, just remember to set the link target to "_blank" (new window).

Also note that the current version of DNN has a bug, so links in tool-tips cannot be clicked on.
User Interface (UI) Settings
Configure how this field behaves in the input form.
Visible In Edit UI

If true (the common value) this input field is visible.

There are only a few cases, where an invisible field makes sense, but we won't tell you about these yet. It's for a future feature :).
If this field is required. The Edit-UI won't allow saving if a required field is blank.
Will permanently disable a field in the UI - so the user can see the value but not change it. You'll be able to change it using code or by prefilling it.
Disable Translation
If enabled, will only be editable in the primary language.
Not translatable
Field Validations

Configure validation settings here to ensure that the field is ok to save or show warnings only. Read more about Field Validation in the docs.

Note that these are work-in-progress and not final yet.
These regular expressions will be used to check if the field is ok. If not valid, will prevent the form from saving. Read more about Field Validation in the docs.

These regular expressions will be used to check if the field is ok, but only show warnings if they fail. So the user can still store the data, but he'll be notified that something might be wrong. Read more about Field Validation in the docs.
Old ValidationRegExJavaScript
OLD feature: Help text: regular expression to validate the input - the UI will not allow saving if this condition is not met - see help with tag validation for more infos.
Custom JavaScript
Execute custom javascript in the edit-form. Use with extreme caution. Read more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=edit-form-development

AttributeSet.Name: @All
AttributeSet.Description: the fields used on all input types

Value.Value: The field label as shown in the edit form
Input Type
Hidden field which tells the UI what input-type to use in a dynamic form
Default Value
Note that you can also set the default value of a drop-down, just remember to use the Key of the drop-down, not the displayed text.

You can also add helpfull links if necessary, like www.2sexycontent.org, just remember to set the link target to "_blank" (new window).

Also note that the current version of DNN has a bug, so links in tool-tips cannot be clicked on.

If enabled, will only be editable in the primary language.
Not translatable

Note that these are work-in-progress and not final yet.
These regular expressions will be used to check if the field is ok. If not valid, will prevent the form from saving. Read more about Field Validation in the docs.

Custom JavaScript

Title when True
Title when False
Title when Indeterminate
This is shown when the field has no value - so it's only relevant for boolean input fields which have 3 states.
Title when True
Title when False
Title when Indeterminate
This is shown when the field has no value - so it's only relevant for boolean input fields which have 3 states.

AttributeSet.Name: @custom-gps
AttributeSet.Description: Configure the input for gps selection

Value.Value: Address Mask
An initial address to search for or better - tokens of form-fields to find an address in the map. example: [Address] [Zip] [City]
An optional field in the form into which the lat-coordinate would be copied automatically by this UI. Example: GPSLat
An optional field in the form into which the lat-coordinate would be copied automatically by this UI. Example: GPSLong
Address Mask
An initial address to search for or better - tokens of form-fields to find an address in the map. example (spaces intended): [Address] [Zip] [City]

AttributeSet.Name: @custom-gps
AttributeSet.Description: Configure the input for gps selection

Value.Value: Address Mask
An initial address to search for or better - tokens of form-fields to find an address in the map. example: [Address] [Zip] [City]
An optional field in the form into which the lat-coordinate would be copied automatically by this UI. Example: GPSLat
An optional field in the form into which the lat-coordinate would be copied automatically by this UI. Example: GPSLong
Address Mask
An initial address to search for or better - tokens of form-fields to find an address in the map. example (spaces intended): [Address] [Zip] [City]
Use Time-Picker
If activated, the picker also enables a time-choice.
Use Time-Picker
If activated, the picker also enables a time-choice.
Collapsed by default
If set to true, then the field group is collapsed by default.
Collapsed by default
If set to true, then the field group is collapsed by default.
Entity Type

The type name of the entity to select. If empty, will return all entities (not usually a good idea).

If you are using a query, this can still be usefull if you want to enable the users to create new items, as this type would be used.
UI Features of the Entity Picker
Multiple Items
Allow picking multiple items - otherwise the user can only pick 1 item.
Enable Edit Items
This activates editing functionality on an item - usually by showing a pencil-icon. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Enable Create New Item
This allows creating new items. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Enable Add Existing Items
This allows users to add existing items. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Enable Remove Item
This allows the user to remove an item in the list. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Enable Delete Item
This would provide a delete (not remove) functionality. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Entity Type

The type name of the entity to select. If empty, will return all entities (not usually a good idea).

If you are using a query, this can still be usefull if you want to enable the users to create new items, as this type would be used.
UI Features of the Entity Picker
Multiple Items
Allow picking multiple items - otherwise the user can only pick 1 item.
Enable Edit Items
This activates editing functionality on an item - usually by showing a pencil-icon. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Enable Create New Item
This allows creating new items. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Enable Add Existing Items
This allows users to add existing items. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Enable Remove Item
This allows the user to remove an item in the list. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Enable Delete Item
This would provide a delete (not remove) functionality. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Pick the query which would be used to prepare the items a user can select.
Stream Name
The Out stream-name which delivers data. Usually "Default"

If your query needs additional parameters in the URL, you can specify them here, in the same syntax as a url. For advanced scenarios you can also use field-names of this content-item to use as a query parameter.

Examples

  • Category=27
  • Category=[Category]
Pick the query which would be used to prepare the items a user can select.
Stream Name
The Out stream-name which delivers data. Usually "Default"

If your query needs additional parameters in the URL, you can specify them here, in the same syntax as a url. For advanced scenarios you can also use field-names of this content-item to use as a query parameter.

Examples

  • Category=27
  • Category=[Category]
Custom File Extensions
Enter the allowed file extensions, comma-separated. Example: "*.jpg,*.bmp,*.png,*.gif" or you can also do "jpg,png,doc" or use regex like "[0-9]{2}.*\.(jpg|png)"
Buttons and Menus
Default Dialog
None:None Automatic Data Asset Manager (ADAM):Adam Page Picker:PagePicker Image Manager:ImageManager File Manager:FileManager
Show Page Picker
Show the page picker in the drop-down (under the ... button)
Show Image Manager
Show the image picker in the drop-down (under the ... button)
Show File Manager
Show the file picker in the drop-down (under the ... button)
Show Adam
Show the ADAM (automatic digital asset manager) in the drop-down menu.
Which buttons to show directly with the input-field. More help here.
Advanced Settings
This is only needed if you use the old file pickers (not ADAM). Specify an existing folder and that will be the root for the file pickers. If you're unsure, best to leave it empty. More help here.
Server Resource References
determine how server resources should be references - the default mode will create links like file:17, the other mode will use /path/file.name
Default (let server manage): Let server manage the link and just use ID:id Link directly and use url:url
Custom File Extensions
Enter the allowed file extensions, comma-separated. Example: "*.jpg,*.bmp,*.png,*.gif" or you can also do "jpg,png,doc" or use regex like "[0-9]{2}.*\.(jpg|png)"
Buttons and Menus
Default Dialog
None:None Automatic Data Asset Manager (ADAM):Adam Page Picker:PagePicker Image Manager:ImageManager File Manager:FileManager
Show Page Picker
Show the page picker in the drop-down (under the ... button)
Show Image Manager
Show the image picker in the drop-down (under the ... button)
Show File Manager
Show the file picker in the drop-down (under the ... button)
Show Adam
Show the ADAM (automatic digital asset manager) in the drop-down menu.
Which buttons to show directly with the input-field. More help here.
Advanced Settings
This is only needed if you use the old file pickers (not ADAM). Specify an existing folder and that will be the root for the file pickers. If you're unsure, best to leave it empty. More help here.
Server Resource References
determine how server resources should be references - the default mode will create links like file:17, the other mode will use /path/file.name
Default (let server manage): Let server manage the link and just use ID:id Link directly and use url:url
Folder Depth

If sub folders are allowed and how deply they may be nested. Use 0 for no sub folders, 1 for 1 level only, 2 for 2 levels (like /gallery/subgallery) etc. Use a large number like 100 for practically unlimited sub folders, but not recommended for realistic use cases.
Allow Assets In Root Folder

Specifies if files may be placed in the core / root container, or if the user is required to create sub folders. This would be the case if you expect multiple groups of files, but never a top-level list.
Metadata Content Types

The content-type (or types) to be used for assets in this library. To use this, first create a content-type (like DownloadMetadata or MugshotMetadata) and type the name of the content type into this field. Advanced configuration is possible, discover on 2sxc.org/help?tag=adam
Folder Depth

If sub folders are allowed and how deply they may be nested. Use 0 for no sub folders, 1 for 1 level only, 2 for 2 levels (like /gallery/subgallery) etc. Use a large number like 100 for practically unlimited sub folders, but not recommended for realistic use cases.
Allow Assets In Root Folder

Specifies if files may be placed in the core / root container, or if the user is required to create sub folders. This would be the case if you expect multiple groups of files, but never a top-level list.
Metadata Content Types

The content-type (or types) to be used for assets in this library. To use this, first create a content-type (like DownloadMetadata or MugshotMetadata) and type the name of the content type into this field. Advanced configuration is possible, discover on 2sxc.org/help?tag=adam
Number of Decimals
Typically 0 (then only integers ergo whole numbers allowed)
Minimum value. Used if you want to ensure that a number is between two values. Leave blank if not needed.
Maximum value. Used if you want to ensure that a number is between two values. Leave blank if not needed.
Number of Decimals
Typically 0 (then only integers ergo whole numbers allowed)
Minimum value. Used if you want to ensure that a number is between two values. Leave blank if not needed.
Maximum value. Used if you want to ensure that a number is between two values. Leave blank if not needed.

AttributeSet.Name: @String
AttributeSet.Description: String UI Definitions - only included for compatibility

Value.Value: Input Type (old / deprecated)
This was an older implementation - do not use any more. It's only included so that old data will still work.
Row Count (old / deprecated)
This was an older implementation - do not use any more. It's only included so that old data will still work.
Dropdown Values (old / deprecated)
This was an older implementation - do not use any more. It's only included so that old data will still work.

AttributeSet.Name: @string-default
AttributeSet.Description: Default single or multi-line string input

AttributeSet.Name: @string-default
AttributeSet.Description: Default single or multi-line string input

Value.Value: Simple Value Another Value Left (will store an l):l Right (will store an r):r Center (... c):c Middle:m

Type in the values, one per line and separate keys:values with a ":".

Example 1
(none):
Left:l
Right:r
Top:t

Example 2
MIT License:MIT
GUN Licnese:GNU
GPL-3 with mentioning of Author:GPL-3-BY
Enable Free Text

Allow users to type other things than are in the drop-down. Two common situations for this:

  • situations where the drop-down will suggest typical values, but others are also possible
  • Situations where you need tokens like [Parameter:Category] which will later be resolved to a real value
Simple Value Another Value Left (will store an l):l Right (will store an r):r Center (... c):c Middle:m

Type in the values, one per line and separate keys:values with a ":".

Example 1
(none):
Left:l
Right:r
Top:t

Example 2
MIT License:MIT
GUN Licnese:GNU
GPL-3 with mentioning of Author:GPL-3-BY
Enable Free Text

Allow users to type other things than are in the drop-down. Two common situations for this:

  • situations where the drop-down will suggest typical values, but others are also possible
  • Situations where you need tokens like [Parameter:Category] which will later be resolved to a real value

AttributeSet.Name: @string-dropdown-query
AttributeSet.Description: Dropdown which receives data from a query

Value.Value: Pick the query which would be used to prepare the items a user can select. For very advanced scenarios you can also manually enter a special query.
Stream Name
The Out-stream name on the query, usually "Default"
Value Field
The field of the items which will be stored as a value.
Label Field
The field which will be shown in the dropdown as the visible field for the user to select.
Advanced settings
In this section you can configure fairly advanced settings - use with care :)

If your query needs additional parameters in the URL, you can specify them here, in the same syntax as a url. For advanced scenarios you can also use field-names of this content-item to use as a query parameter.

Examples

  • Category=27
  • Category=[Category]
Enable Free Text

Allow users to type other things than are in the drop-down. Two common situations for this:

  • situations where the drop-down will suggest typical values, but others are also possible
  • Situations where you need tokens like [Parameter:Category] which will later be resolved to a real value
UI Features of the Entity Picker
Enable Edit Items
This activates editing functionality on an item - usually by showing a pencil-icon. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Enable Remove Item
This allows the user to remove an item in the list. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Multi-Select Options
Use these if you want to enable selecting multiple items
Multiple Items
Allow picking multiple items - otherwise the user can only pick 1 item.
If you want to support selecting multiple items, you'll need something to keep them separate. We recommend a comma, but maybe you want something different

AttributeSet.Name: @string-dropdown-query
AttributeSet.Description: Dropdown which receives data from a query

  • situations where the drop-down will suggest typical values, but others are also possible
  • Situations where you need tokens like [Parameter:Category] which will later be resolved to a real value
UI Features of the Entity Picker
Enable Edit Items
This activates editing functionality on an item - usually by showing a pencil-icon. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Enable Remove Item
This allows the user to remove an item in the list. Learn more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=field-entity
Multi-Select Options
Use these if you want to enable selecting multiple items
Multiple Items
Allow picking multiple items - otherwise the user can only pick 1 item.
If you want to support selecting multiple items, you'll need something to keep them separate. We recommend a comma, but maybe you want something different
Css Prefix
The beginning of the CSS-information used to identify an icon - is used to find all classes that start with this. Common examples are ".icon-something-"). find out more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=font-icon
Preview Css Classes

Additional CSS classes to apply to the preview tags. Leave blank for modern solutions like fontello, add the appropriate additonal classes like "fa" for font-awesome or "glyphicons" for glyphicons. find out more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=font-icon

Files to load in this dialog - usually the list of CSS-files which would contain icon-definitions. You can also use the placeholder [App:Path] to inject the app, path, like [App:Path]/dist/custom-icons.css.

Remember that these styles will also affect the styling of the entire form, so try to include files which only include the icon-definitions. You could also create separate icon-definition files just for this icon picker.  find out more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=font-icon
Show Prefix
Show or hide the prefix in the dropdown (like fa- in font-awesome)
Icon prefix is hidden
Icon prefix is default (hidden)
Icon prefix is visible
Css Prefix
The beginning of the CSS-information used to identify an icon - is used to find all classes that start with this. Common examples are ".icon-something-"). find out more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=font-icon
Preview Css Classes

Additional CSS classes to apply to the preview tags. Leave blank for modern solutions like fontello, add the appropriate additonal classes like "fa" for font-awesome or "glyphicons" for glyphicons. find out more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=font-icon

Files to load in this dialog - usually the list of CSS-files which would contain icon-definitions. You can also use the placeholder [App:Path] to inject the app, path, like [App:Path]/dist/custom-icons.css.

Remember that these styles will also affect the styling of the entire form, so try to include files which only include the icon-definitions. You could also create separate icon-definition files just for this icon picker.  find out more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=font-icon
Show Prefix
Show or hide the prefix in the dropdown (like fa- in font-awesome)
Icon prefix is hidden
Icon prefix is default (hidden)
Icon prefix is visible
Auto Generate Path Mask
Will let you automatically pick up a value - like the item-title - and use it to generate the initial path. Default is [Title] which would use the title-field.
Allow Slashes inside Path

This would allow path-parts with slashes inside the path - so word1/word2 would be allowed. Usually you don't want this, because in most cases you will want to have only non-slash words in this url-part.
Auto Generate Path Mask
Will let you automatically pick up a value - like the item-title - and use it to generate the initial path. Default is [Title] which would use the title-field.
Allow Slashes inside Path

This would allow path-parts with slashes inside the path - so word1/word2 would be allowed. Usually you don't want this, because in most cases you will want to have only non-slash words in this url-part.
Dialog Type
Determines if the wysiwyg is opened in a dialog (default behaviour in 2sxc 10).
Default (dialog): Use dialog:dialog Place in form without dialog:inline
Content Css File
additional css file to load into the wysiwyg
HTML Source
Default (enabled): Enable:true Disable:false
Default (enabled): Enable advanced:true Disable advanced:false
Dialog Type
Determines if the wysiwyg is opened in a dialog (default behaviour in 2sxc 10).
Default (dialog): Use dialog:dialog Place in form without dialog:inline
Content Css File
additional css file to load into the wysiwyg
HTML Source
Default (enabled): Enable:true Disable:false
Default (enabled): Enable advanced:true Disable advanced:false
Display Name
The name of the app as shown in the app-picker. Can be translated to other languages as needed.
A short description of this app - more for your own use.
A version - needed for various checks - in the format 01.03.08
The folder of this app within the 2sxc-folder - only change this if you know what you're doing.
Token Templates
Allow token templates. As of now, this is only informative. In the future, it may be used to enforce certain rules.
Razor Templates
Allow token templates. As of now, this is only informative. In the future, it may be used to enforce certain rules.
Show / hide this in the app selector. Advanced apps are usually set to hidden once the developer adds them to the necessary pages.
Original Id
A GUID of the original app. This is used for cases where you clone an app with another id, and we want to remember the original ID - for example to point to help content.
Required Version
The version of 2sxc required for this app to work. Use it when you rely on 2sxc features which don't exist is other versions. read more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=app
Required DNN Version
The version of DNN required for this app to work. Use it when you rely on DNN features which don't exist is other versions. read more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=app
Supports Ajax Reload

If your views can handle being reloaded inside the page without requiring a page-refresh, then activate this. This setting applies to all views in this app, so only use it if your app is fully AJAX ready. Read more about this in 2sxc.org/help?tag=ajax
Display Name
The name of the app as shown in the app-picker. Can be translated to other languages as needed.
A short description of this app - more for your own use.
A version - needed for various checks - in the format 01.03.08
The folder of this app within the 2sxc-folder - only change this if you know what you're doing.
Token Templates
Allow token templates. As of now, this is only informative. In the future, it may be used to enforce certain rules.
Razor Templates
Allow token templates. As of now, this is only informative. In the future, it may be used to enforce certain rules.
Show / hide this in the app selector. Advanced apps are usually set to hidden once the developer adds them to the necessary pages.
Original Id
A GUID of the original app. This is used for cases where you clone an app with another id, and we want to remember the original ID - for example to point to help content.
Required Version
The version of 2sxc required for this app to work. Use it when you rely on 2sxc features which don't exist is other versions. read more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=app
Required DNN Version
The version of DNN required for this app to work. Use it when you rely on DNN features which don't exist is other versions. read more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=app
Supports Ajax Reload

If your views can handle being reloaded inside the page without requiring a page-refresh, then activate this. This setting applies to all views in this app, so only use it if your app is fully AJAX ready. Read more about this in 2sxc.org/help?tag=ajax
This is a refernce to the view - internally it's called Template.
This was previously called ListContent - but that was confusing.
Header Presentation
This was previously called ListPresentation, but this was confusing.
This is a refernce to the view - internally it's called Template.
This was previously called ListContent - but that was confusing.
Header Presentation
This was previously called ListPresentation, but this was confusing.
just a nice name which will be shown in dropdowns and similar
Name in URL Path

specify this if you want this template to be activated automatically, when some keywords appear in the url - like showing details when /post/395 is in the path (note: this only works in Apps) - read more
Hide from editor
hide this template from the normal selection - this is for templates you only want to insert once or twice, and then prevent additional uses

The template is a html or code file, which is will generate the output. It could be simple HTML showing a decorative line, a token-based HTML with placeholders like [Content:Title], or an advanced c# Razor template with placeholders like @Content.Title as well as conditions, loops etc.
C# Razor
this type determines which view-engine will be used to render the result
Token C# Razor
Portal File System
templates are usually stored in the portal - or in rare cases or in the shared, default-zone - note that sharing templates has various caveats, so you should read about shared templates here
Portal File System Host File System
Template file
choose or create the template file - more help
Content Specs
Templates show either Content, Data, both, or neither. If you're just getting started, Content is the way to go. Read more about this in the online help.
Content Type
the type of content this template will show - like a person, simple content, etc.
Content Demo Item
this item will be used for previews, so the user can see what the template does without entering any data
Presentation Options
Presentation settings are used to configure how your content will be shown. You can do very sophisticated things with this. Read more about it in help.
Content Type
the content-type which is used for presentation-settings
Demo item

this will contain a demo entity which is used as a default (when the editor doesn't provide custom presentation settings) as well as for preview - when the template is just showing the demo-item to the editor - more
List Settings

You can create templates which show multiple items - like a list of links or images. enable this here to tell the edit-UI, that this template can show more than just 1 item - so this will provide more buttons like add, move-up/down, etc. - more
Enable list
turn this on, to tell the UI that this template handles lists
Header Item ContentType
this is the content-type for the header-item (called the ListContent) in a list-template - more
Demo Item for the Header (ListContent)
the default / demo-item for the list header (ListContent) item - more
Content Type of the Header Presentation (ListContent.Presentation)
configure presentation settings of the list header - read more about lists or presentation settings
Demo Item for the Header Presentation
the default/demo item for list presentations - more about presentation settings
Data for this Template

A template instance can work with Content, Data, both or neither. Here you can configure the system to provide pre-processed data to the template. more

Important: queries can only be used in views of an App. They are not available for normal Content. more
Data Query
a prepared query which will provide data to this template - more
Advanced Settings
These settings are fairly advanced and you will usually not need them. Read more.
Enable Data-Publishing
enables instances of this view to provide the data it would render on the server as JSON - more about templates and more about publishing JSON data
Published Streams
if you choose to publish data, you must specify which streams you will publish for security reasons - more
just a nice name which will be shown in dropdowns and similar
Name in URL Path

specify this if you want this template to be activated automatically, when some keywords appear in the url - like showing details when /post/395 is in the path (note: this only works in Apps) - read more
Hide from editor
hide this template from the normal selection - this is for templates you only want to insert once or twice, and then prevent additional uses

The template is a html or code file, which is will generate the output. It could be simple HTML showing a decorative line, a token-based HTML with placeholders like [Content:Title], or an advanced c# Razor template with placeholders like @Content.Title as well as conditions, loops etc.
C# Razor
this type determines which view-engine will be used to render the result
Token C# Razor
Portal File System
templates are usually stored in the portal - or in rare cases or in the shared, default-zone - note that sharing templates has various caveats, so you should read about shared templates here
Portal File System Host File System
Template file
choose or create the template file - more help
Content Specs
Templates show either Content, Data, both, or neither. If you're just getting started, Content is the way to go. Read more about this in the online help.
Content Type
the type of content this template will show - like a person, simple content, etc.
Content Demo Item
this item will be used for previews, so the user can see what the template does without entering any data
Presentation Options
Presentation settings are used to configure how your content will be shown. You can do very sophisticated things with this. Read more about it in help.
Content Type
the content-type which is used for presentation-settings
Demo item

this will contain a demo entity which is used as a default (when the editor doesn't provide custom presentation settings) as well as for preview - when the template is just showing the demo-item to the editor - more
List Settings

You can create templates which show multiple items - like a list of links or images. enable this here to tell the edit-UI, that this template can show more than just 1 item - so this will provide more buttons like add, move-up/down, etc. - more
Enable list
turn this on, to tell the UI that this template handles lists
Header Item ContentType
this is the content-type for the header-item (called the ListContent) in a list-template - more
Demo Item for the Header (ListContent)
the default / demo-item for the list header (ListContent) item - more
Content Type of the Header Presentation (ListContent.Presentation)
configure presentation settings of the list header - read more about lists or presentation settings
Demo Item for the Header Presentation
the default/demo item for list presentations - more about presentation settings
Data for this Template

A template instance can work with Content, Data, both or neither. Here you can configure the system to provide pre-processed data to the template. more

Important: queries can only be used in views of an App. They are not available for normal Content. more
Data Query
a prepared query which will provide data to this template - more
Advanced Settings
These settings are fairly advanced and you will usually not need them. Read more.
Enable Data-Publishing
enables instances of this view to provide the data it would render on the server as JSON - more about templates and more about publishing JSON data
Published Streams
if you choose to publish data, you must specify which streams you will publish for security reasons - more

AttributeSet.Name: 2SexyContent-Template-Asset
AttributeSet.Description: Documents assets used in a template.

Value.Value: Title of the asset - usually displayed in the how-it's done and in asset-lists.
Internal notes about this asset, purpose, description or special issues.
What kind of asset this is / type.
Relative Path

The path to a resource under the current portals file path. Relative because it can be in Portals/0/, in Portals/MySite/ etc.

Example: 2Sexy\Demo\MyFile.css

Wrong:
\2Sexy\Demo\MyFile.css (with leading slash)
Link to the asset (if not using the relative path, or if the asset is external).
Include Automatically
Automatically include this file (without a tag being issued from the template).
Include Priority
Used only if activating Client-Dependency Auto-Include, the order of including this.
Type Name
Content Type ID
ID of the content-type in the DB. It uses the number instead of reference because it's a legacy thing. During import/export it's automatically mapped as needed.
Demo Entity ID
Number of the demo-entity to be used when no data has been added.

AttributeSet.Name: 2SexyContent-Template-Metadata
AttributeSet.Description: Information about a template, mainly used in import/export

Value.Value: A visible name for the template. This is not an technical identifier. Please write something nice with spaces and everything so it's easy to read.
Your name or your company
Describe the template/tool, what it does etc.
Info Link
A link to further information, typically your web site containing a demo.
Choose your license (we recommend MIT)
License Notes
Add additional licensing comments here (usually blank)
License Link
Set the link showing details for this licenses type
Installation Notes and Instructions
Put special instructions here, especially if you don't have a checklist (usually blank)
Installation Checklist ID
The SwissChecklist ID of the installation checklist (the 8-char code)
The mode determines how Polymorphism should auto-detect other editions.
None: Koi CSS Framework:Koi?cssFramework Host user staging/live:Permissions?IsSuperUser
The mode determines how Polymorphism should auto-detect other editions.
None: Koi CSS Framework:Koi?cssFramework Host user staging/live:Permissions?IsSuperUser
Override AppRootFolder
Set this with caution - this will override the default app-root, which is usually something like "adam/[AppFolder]/"

AttributeSet.Name: App-Resources
AttributeSet.Description: Stores resources like translations for an app

AttributeSet.Name: ContentGroupReference
AttributeSet.Description: A pointer / reference to a content group

Value.Value: Content Group

AttributeSet.Name: ContentGroupReference
AttributeSet.Description: A pointer / reference to a content group

Value.Value: Content Group
This is the nice name shown in the end user dialogs. You should keep it short and simple. Read the recommendations in help.
A nice description of what this content-type is for. It will be shown as tool-tip or help-text in normal user dialogs, so keep it simple and non-techie.
Use this for internal, technical notes. It won't be shown to the content editors.
You can give this content-type an icon to use in tile-style buttons. Read the recommendations in help.
This is an optional link to further information, tutorials, help, etc. It will be shown to the end user if such a link exists.
Edit Instructions
Instructions shown to the user in the edit-form for additional help/assistance.
List Instructions
This text will be shown above the normal list of items to provide context or help. That will be implemented in 2sxc 10, ATM it doesn't happen yet.
This is the nice name shown in the end user dialogs. You should keep it short and simple. Read the recommendations in help.
A nice description of what this content-type is for. It will be shown as tool-tip or help-text in normal user dialogs, so keep it simple and non-techie.
Use this for internal, technical notes. It won't be shown to the content editors.
You can give this content-type an icon to use in tile-style buttons. Read the recommendations in help.
This is an optional link to further information, tutorials, help, etc. It will be shown to the end user if such a link exists.
Edit Instructions
Instructions shown to the user in the edit-form for additional help/assistance.
List Instructions
This text will be shown above the normal list of items to provide context or help. That will be implemented in 2sxc 10, ATM it doesn't happen yet.

AttributeSet.Name: ContentType-InputType
AttributeSet.Description: Input type definition for a content-type

Value.Value: Angular Form Configuration
These are settings which apply to 2sxc 10
Disable Internationalization
Don't allow this information to be translated - for example when the user presses translate-all
These assets are only for the new Angular form in 2sxc 10.
Use ADAM
When enabled, the various wrappers are ensured which provide ADAM functionality.

AttributeSet.Name: ContentType-InputType
AttributeSet.Description: Input type definition for a content-type

Value.Value: Angular Form Configuration
These are settings which apply to 2sxc 10
Disable Internationalization
Don't allow this information to be translated - for example when the user presses translate-all
These assets are only for the new Angular form in 2sxc 10.
Use ADAM
When enabled, the various wrappers are ensured which provide ADAM functionality.

AttributeSet.Name: DataPipeline
AttributeSet.Description: Describes a set of data sources and how they are interconnected.

Value.Value: Pipeline name
Descriptive Name
Short info about this pipeline, what it's for
Allow Edit
If set to false, the pipeline-system will only show this pipeline but not allow changes.
Streams Out
Comma separated list of streams this pipeline offers to the target. Like 'Content, Presentation, ListContent, ListPresentation'
Stream Wiring
List of connections between the parts of this pipeline, each connection on one line, like 6730:Default>6732:Default
Parameters for Testing and Runtime
The Test Parameters are for testing only, while the Parameters are used for the Params LookUp - for tokens like [Params:Id]. Read more about Query Params in the docs.

Parameters used in this query. One on each line. Format like Key=Value. Examples: 

  • Id=27
  • Id=[QueryString:Id]
  • Id=[QueryString:Id||27]
Test Parameters

Test parameters, one per line. See docs. Syntax is

  • [source:property]=value
  • [source:property]=[othersource:property]

AttributeSet.Name: DataPipeline
AttributeSet.Description: Describes a set of data sources and how they are interconnected.

Value.Value: Pipeline name
Descriptive Name
Short info about this pipeline, what it's for
Allow Edit
If set to false, the pipeline-system will only show this pipeline but not allow changes.
Streams Out
Comma separated list of streams this pipeline offers to the target. Like 'Content, Presentation, ListContent, ListPresentation'
Stream Wiring
List of connections between the parts of this pipeline, each connection on one line, like 6730:Default>6732:Default
Parameters for Testing and Runtime
The Test Parameters are for testing only, while the Parameters are used for the Params LookUp - for tokens like [Params:Id]. Read more about Query Params in the docs.

Parameters used in this query. One on each line. Format like Key=Value. Examples: 

  • Id=27
  • Id=[QueryString:Id]
  • Id=[QueryString:Id||27]
Test Parameters

Test parameters, one per line. See docs. Syntax is

  • [source:property]=value
  • [source:property]=[othersource:property]

AttributeSet.Name: DataPipelinePart
AttributeSet.Description: A part in the data pipeline, usually a data source/target element.

Value.Value: The part name for easy identification by the user
Notes about this item
Part Assembly and Type
Assembly and type info to help the system find this dll etc.
Visual Designer Data
Technical data for the designer so it can save it's values etc.

AttributeSet.Name: DataPipelinePart
AttributeSet.Description: A part in the data pipeline, usually a data source/target element.

Value.Value: The part name for easy identification by the user
Notes about this item
Part Assembly and Type
Assembly and type info to help the system find this dll etc.
Visual Designer Data
Technical data for the designer so it can save it's values etc.
a verification key to ensure the configuration is certified / approved
a verification key to ensure the configuration is certified / approved
Security Rule
A title just to help you know what this rule is for.
You can type in a user GUID here, or group number(s) like "5, 12". Make sure you enable the feature.

Why this security rule should apply.
Learn more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=permissions

Please Select: SecurityAccessLevel.Anonymous SecurityAccessLevel.View SecurityAccessLevel.Edit SecurityAccessLevel.Admin SecurityAccessLevel.Host SecurityAccessLevel.ControlPanel SecurityAccessLevel.SkinObject SecurityAccessLevel.ViewPermissions Author / Creator of a Content-Item:Owner

What we will grant in this rule. 
Learn more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=permissions

None (no permissions defined):- Read:r Create (no read or edit):c Update (read and modify existing):ru Delete:d Edit (Create, Read, Update, Delete):crud All Content (CRUD + Approve):cruda All Content + Permissions:crudap Design/Develop (modify internal structure):crudav Design and Permissions:crudavp Full Control (usually host only):crudavpz Read schema (applies to content-types):$ Read drafts (applies to content-types): Create draft (applies to content-types): Update drafts (applies to content-types): Edit draft CRUD (applies to centent-types):
Security Rule
A title just to help you know what this rule is for.
You can type in a user GUID here, or group number(s) like "5, 12". Make sure you enable the feature.

Why this security rule should apply.
Learn more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=permissions

Please Select: SecurityAccessLevel.Anonymous SecurityAccessLevel.View SecurityAccessLevel.Edit SecurityAccessLevel.Admin SecurityAccessLevel.Host SecurityAccessLevel.ControlPanel SecurityAccessLevel.SkinObject SecurityAccessLevel.ViewPermissions Author / Creator of a Content-Item:Owner

What we will grant in this rule. 
Learn more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=permissions

None (no permissions defined):- Read:r Create (no read or edit):c Update (read and modify existing):ru Delete:d Edit (Create, Read, Update, Delete):crud All Content (CRUD + Approve):cruda All Content + Permissions:crudap Design/Develop (modify internal structure):crudav Design and Permissions:crudavp Full Control (usually host only):crudavpz Read schema (applies to content-types):$ Read drafts (applies to content-types): Create draft (applies to content-types): Update drafts (applies to content-types): Edit draft CRUD (applies to centent-types):
Test for ...
Just a nice title for your convenience, so you know what this regex is for.
The Regular Expression in JS standard.
Warning: field validation failed.
Message to show to the user if the expression fails.
Invert Result

Normally an expression is ok, if the regex matches the value found. In some cases, you would rather say "it shouldn't match the expression" for blacklisting certain things. So if you want the expression to not match, then activate this toggle.
Test for ...
Just a nice title for your convenience, so you know what this regex is for.
The Regular Expression in JS standard.
Warning: field validation failed.
Message to show to the user if the expression fails.
Invert Result

Normally an expression is ok, if the regex matches the value found. In some cases, you would rather say "it shouldn't match the expression" for blacklisting certain things. So if you want the expression to not match, then activate this toggle.
Portal File System
C# Razor
standard drop-down with text entries
To discover more about the drop-down type, consult the wiki.
drop-down with values from a query

This configuration lets you specify a query which shows the items a user will pick. This allows you to use different criterias for pre-filtering the data you want to allow, or to provide data from other apps. You can read more about this in the wiki.

Note that this is especially useful to select data from a query, where you want to save a text-value (like a field-name, a value from SQL etc.). If you want to store an item-relationship, you should use the entity-query field instead.
drop-down from query
Boolean UI Definitions
The boolean field doesn't have any settings to configure.
Boolean (yes/no)
DateTime UI Definitions
The general date-time doesn't have much to configure. See wiki.
Date and Time
File UI Definitions
Point to a link, a file, or even a set of files.
Hyperlink / Link / File / Document
Configuration for a number field
Let users pick / set a number.
Default single or multi-line string input
Basic strings / texts are simple text fields. See wiki for more.
String / Text Basic
Configure a font-icon picker
Select an icon from an icon-font. See wiki for detailed instructions.
Font-Icon Picker
Configuration for a string-url-path field
Allows text-input, but only for url-valid characters. Ideal to auto-generate path-parts based on other fields like the title. See wiki for more.
URL Path / Path-Part
the fields used on all input types
General field configuration which is valid for almost any field. See wiki for more.
General Settings
Metadata for a content-type
This is (optional) metadata for the content-type. Imagine it as added information, which if available, will be used in dialogs to enhance the user experience.
Content Type
Describes a set of data sources and how they are interconnected.
A Query (DataPipeline) is the definition type of a Visual-Query, containing title, description and hidden information like wiring between the parts.
A part in the data pipeline, usually a data source/target element.

This is an internal data-type, usually invisible to the user. It contains the specs for a DataSource part inside a VisualQuery (DataPipeline). You should usually not edit this yourself, as you'll probably break something.
Query Part
For configuring permissions.

Configure the permissions of views or content-types (see wiki). 

If you want to use new user-identity or groups in the permissions, you'll need to enable the user-feature or group-feature. For the public-users-can-only-create draft data, make sure you also enable that feature.
Permission Configuration
System Types
Describes a 2sxc App
App Specifications
Contains a content group in 2sxc

Content-Groups are a fundamental part of 2sxc - they contain the definition of a set of selected items and how they should be displayed. You should almost never edit this - for more information read about it in the wiki.
Content Group
Contains all registered 2sxc templates
Templates / Views determine how output is shown. This dialog helps you configure what file is used, what data it expects and more.
View Configuration
Template Defaults for various content-types
ContentTypes of a Template
A pointer / reference to a content group

A reference to a content-group. As the target group/block could be inside another app, all fields are simple string fields, because they can't enforce that the target exists. See also what the wiki says about this.
Content Group Reference
Include zone in folder pattern
String UI Definitions - only included for compatibility to old app-imports
Strings don't have any own settings - all string settings are at the specific input-element.
String (Text)
to pick a location with a map - can also store the values in separate number fields and auto-find an address based on values in the form
GPS Picker
Configuration for a json-editor field
Beta field - please be careful with it. It's basically just a multi-line text field, and doesn't do json validation at the moment.
Custom JSON
Configuration for a json-editor field
Careful - this is still in beta - it's basically just a multi-line field without any features. So it won't do json validation for you.
Custom JSON editor
An empty field (will not store data) for Headings/Groups
Empty (default) for Field Groups
Configuration of the Field-Groups
Empty fields don't get stored in the DB, but are ideal to structure the input-dialog.
Groups, Titles and Instructions
Configure a file-library field containing folders, files and more.
Many files, optionally in folders - just for this field. Ideal for galeries and more. Each file and folder can also have additional metadata if configured.
File Library
to choose one or more content items preserving the sorting-order
Item/Entity Picker (default)
standard single/multiple entity/item picker
default (entity/item picker)
Library of files, optionally with folders and file/folder metadata
Library of files
Container for inner-content references
Content-Blocks Container
Use this to manage inner content-blocks - discover more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=content-blocks
Content Block Items
entity-picker with query configuration

In addition to the primary type, you can also use a query. This allows you to use different criterias for pre-filtering the data you want to allow, or to provide data from other apps. You can read more about this in the wiki.

Note that this is especially useful to select data from a query, where you want to save a relationship (like blog-post / tag, book/author, etc.). If you want to store a text-value, like a field-name, a value from SQL etc. you want to use the string-dropdown-query instead.
Query based item-picker
Entity UI Definitions
Entities / Relationships let the user pick other data. See wiki for more.
Entities or Relationships
Select items/relationships based on visual queries.
Query based entity/item-picker
Configure the input for gps selection
Custom GPS
light wysiwyg-editor (recommended) - without images or advanced formating, as is usually the case in professional content-templates.
WYSIWYG editor (default)
Input type definition for a content-type

These objects must be attached to the content type to have an affect - so create them as metadata for a content type so they will be exported together with the content-type definition. 

You only need to create this object for content-types which need extra configuration, so you won't find an input type in this list for every type which exists.
Custom InputType Configuration

These objects must be attached to the content type to have an affect - so create them as metadata for a content type so they will be exported together with the content-type definition. 

Note that the primary list for input-types is all global types with @ in front of the name, so you only need to create this object (as metadata) for content-types which need extra configuration. You won't find an input type in this list for every type which exists.

Url-Path or Path-Part
Edit text like using word with the tiny-mce rich-text editor
Configure settings for the default Wysiwyg editor. For more advanced customizations you need to create a custom Wysiwyg WebComponent.
WYSIWYG (default)
This is the default, so for now it's the same as string-wysiwyg. But in future, we may change the default editor, in which case this would probably still revert to TinyMCE.
Wysiwyg TinyMCE (rich text using TinyMCE)
use to refer to a page, image, document, whatever
default (link, page, file, ...)
light wysiwyg-editor (recommended) - without images or advanced formating, as is usually the case in professional content-templates.
wysiwyg editor (tinymce)
Used to validate fields

Configur a regular expression check here. It will usually be used in JavaScript, so make sure your RegEx adheres to the JavaScript RegEx standard. You can develop/test your regex in online tools like the RegExr.
Regular Expression (BETA, not final)
Based on this configuration, 2sxc will use other template files if it can find them. To understand this and discover more, read about polymorphism.
View Polymorphism Configuration
